title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \

1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Quiz 2
text:
title: “Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita” execute: echo: true —
This page shows how life expectancy relates to GDP per capita in the Gapminder dataset.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
plt.scatter(df[“gdp_per_capita”], df[“life_expectancy”]) plt.xlabel(“GDP per capita)”) plt.ylabel(“Life expectancy”) plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page shows how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for one country.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gapminder = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
country_name = “Brazil”
df = gapminder[gapminder[“country”] == country_name].sort_values(“year”)
plt.figure() plt.plot(df[“year”], df[“life_expectancy”]) plt.xlabel(“Year”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.title(f”Life Expectancy Over Time: {country_name}“) plt.show()
plt.figure() plt.plot(df[“year”], df[“gdp_per_capita”]) plt.xlabel(“Year”) plt.ylabel(“GDP per Capita”) plt.title(f”GDP per Capita Over Time: {country_name}“) plt.show()
plt.figure() plt.plot(df[“year”], df[“population_millions”]) plt.xlabel(“Year”) plt.ylabel(“Population (millions)”) plt.title(f”Population Over Time: {country_name}“) plt.show()

title: Quiz 2
text: The Gapminder dataset includes country based information on continent, year, life expectancy, population, and GDP per capita.

title: Quiz 2
text:
title: “Life Expectancy and Population” execute: echo: true —
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population (in millions) using the Gapminder dataset.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gapminder = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
plt.figure() plt.scatter(gapminder[“population_millions”], gapminder[“life_expectancy”]) plt.xlabel(“Population (millions)”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.title(“Life Expectancy vs Population”) plt.show()
